#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Appear Busy While Using a Computer

#Text=For people in school , at work or doing some " homework " using a computer on a daily/hourly basis , this wikiHow explains how you can look productive while not actually doing anything or just procrastinating without letting anyone know .
#Text=If you have the inclination to look busy , but be doing nothing work-related , read on from step number one below .
#Text=Steps
#Text=If you have a scheduled assignment , keep it in the taskbar and prepare to fast-click to it at a second 's notice .
#Text=Alt-tab can also be useful here .
#Text=Intersperse work with downtime by working for a few moments followed by IMing , Facebooking , Googling , or whatever it is you feel like doing .
#Text=This way you can relax and do your job , albeit slowly , at the same time .
#Text=Write a wikiHow article on something you know about .
#Text=It looks like work , and takes a good amount of typing to do .
#Text=It 's a perfect cover , but wo n't impress your boss if you 're being paid to do tasks .
#Text=If you 're at home with a laptop then try sitting with your back to a wall .
#Text=That way no one can see what you 're doing .
#Text=Do a lot of typing that looks productive .
#Text=Make sure that even if you are n't doing much work , have something that looks like work open , such as an end of quarter PowerPoint or something of the sort .
#Text=Tips
#Text=If you are at work , a library , or any other public place , it may be a good idea to strategically place open books , folders , or papers on and around your desk or table .
#Text=Be sure to turn the pages once in a while , or pretend to read them , to increase believability .
#Text=When somebody tells you something , do n't answer immediately and say , ' Shhh !
#Text=Ca n't you see I 'm busy ? I ca n't focus both at you and at what I 'm doing now ! '
#Text=In Windows , hitting the Windows and the D key simultaneously will take you to your Desktop instantly .
#Text=If you get caught , be prepared with an excuse .
#Text=Keep it real !
#Text=If you 're working online and using a tabbed web browser , it 's simple to do anything you want in one tab while doing work in another .
#Text=Or , try installing a remote access software such as LogMeIn on your computer , which is accessible by browser , so you can access your home computer and do stuff from anywhere .
#Text=It 's easier to appear busy if you actually are busy ! Play a game or go on wikihow , it 's more fun than just sitting there .
#Text=Using a proxy can usually bypass filters/blocking software , but it can get you in trouble with the school IT director , so try to avoid it if you can
#Text=Turn down/off the volume of the computer , as the bleeps and bloops of IM and other messengers will tip you off .
#Text=Practice using the Alt-Tab strategy .
#Text=You can immediately switch to another open program without using the mouse .
#Text=Do n't spend the whole period doing this .
#Text=You need to do your work ; this is just for little breaks you might need .
#Text=You can always keep open a work file .
#Text=For instance :
#Text=If you 're on Myspace , or email when you should be writing a paper , keep the paper opened but minimized .
#Text=Always look serious .
#Text=Try not to laugh !
#Text=Warnings
#Text=You might get caught , be alert at all times .
#Text=Do n't click out of something fast , that will draw a teacher or professors attention .
#Text=Just calmly click into another page or always go to Yahoo.com or Google !
#Text=Do n't play Solitaire/Minesweeper/any other silly game if you want to appear busy .
#Text=Being caught doing something as trivial as that only shows how bored you really are .
#Text=Do n't appear to be too interested , that is a sign that you 're not doing work .
#Text=Things You 'll Need
#Text=Computer
#Text=Time
#Text=Skills in covering up
